text: Feeling Free is an album by guitarist Barney Kessel recorded in 1969 and released on the Contemporary label.Contemporary Records discography accessed May 25, 2015 The album marked a brief return to the label before Kessel embarked on an extended stay in Europe. ==Reception== The Allmusic review by Scott Yanow states: "Although none of the musicians was associated exclusively with the avant-garde (Elvin Jones came the closest but never quite embraced free jazz), they show the influence of the explorations of the era, using aspects of the innovations as a logical way to stretch the jazz mainstream. Fascinating music". ==Track listing== All compositions by Barney Kessel except as indicated # "Moving Up" - 5:14 # "Blue Grass" - 9:24 # "This Guy's in Love with You" (Burt Bacharach, Hal David) - 5:14 # "Blues up, Down and All Around" - 8:21 # "The Sound of Silence" (Paul Simon) - 7:39 # "Two Note Samba" - 4:55 ==Personnel== *Barney Kessel - guitar *Bobby Hutcherson - vibraphone *Chuck Domanico - bass *Elvin Jones - drums ==References== Category:Contemporary Records albums Category:Barney Kessel albums Category:1969 albums
title: Feeling Free
